poem:
### Political Ephemera

Stepping into the morning,
I ponder the soles of Starmer,
or Thatcher's face on a teacup—

Politics in trinkets,
small, odd insignias 
that jingle like loose change.
In 2024, we'll hold democracy 
in the palms of our hands,
or maybe wear it underfoot.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer on your soles and Thatcher on your teacup: we vote for the best, worst and weirdest election merch You may have snapped up a Renaissance tour T-shirt when you went to see Beyoncé or display your loyalty to your local coffee shop by carrying around its branded reusable cup. But have you thought about buying a memento of the 2024 general election? Political parties are betting on it (not just the Conservatives this time)". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

But have you thought about buying a memento of the 2024 general election? Political parties are betting on it (not just the Conservatives this time)
